description: Number of equivalence classes of Boolean functions modulo linear functions.
comments: Number of equivalence classes of all 2^(2^n) maps from GF(2)^n to GF(2), where maps f and g are equivalent iff there exists an invertible n X n binary matrix M, two n-dimensional binary vectors a and b and a binary scalar c such that g(x) = f(Mx+a) + b.x + c.
references: Berlekamp, Elwyn R. and Welch, Lloyd R., Weight distributions of the cosets of the (32,6) Reed-Muller code, IEEE Trans. Information Theory, IT-18 (1972), 203-207.
Xiang-Dong Hou, AGL(m,2) acting on R(r,m)/R(s,m), J. Algebra, 171 (1995), 921-938.
R. J. Lechner, Harmonic Analysis of Switching Functions, in A. Mukhopadhyay, ed., Recent Developments in Switching Theory, Acad. Press, 1971, pp. 121-254, esp. p. 186.
F. J. MacWilliams and N. J. A. Sloane, The Theory of Error-Correcting Codes, Elsevier-North Holland, 1977, p. 431.
I. Strazdins, Universal affine classification of Boolean functions, Acta Applic. Math. 46 (1997), 147-167.
links: An Braeken, Yuri Borissov, Svetla Nikova and Bart Preneel, Classification of Boolean Functions of 6 Variables or Less with Respect to Cryptographic Properties
L. E. Danielsen, Database of Boolean functions
Index entries for sequences related to Boolean functions
author: _N. J. A. Sloane_.
